intro: Tococa quadrialata, commonly known as the four-leafed tococa, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
